# Integer Representation

### 128 -> -128
```
10000000
-1
01111111
xor
10000000
```

### 129 -> -129
```
10000001
-1
10000000
^
01111111
sign extend this son of a bitch
11111111 01111111
```

### -129 -> 129
```
11111111 01111111
-1
11111111 01111110
^
00000000 10000001
  /\
can probably remove because it's 0
```

### 255 -> -255
```
11111111
-1
11111110
^
00000001
sign extend this son of a bitch
11111111 00000001
```

### -255 -> 255
```
11111111 00000001
-1
11111111 00000000
^
00000000 11111111
  /\
can probably remove because it's 0
```

### 511 -> -511
```
00000001 11111111
-1
00000001 11111110
^
11111110 00000001
```

### 32767 -> -32767
```
01111111 11111111
-1
01111111 11111110
^
10000000 00000001
```

### 32768 -> -32768
```
10000000 00000000
-1
01111111 11111111
^
10000000 00000000
```

### 32769 -> -32769
```
10000000 00000001
-1
10000000 00000000
^
11111111 11111111 01111111 11111111
```

### Sign extension
Is should happen only if the first byte is bigger than `180` and any other byte is bigger than `0`.
